content.description:
Lover's Quarrel climbs an overhung face on good rock via nice movement.

Sit start with a good right hand finger-lock and a smaller left hand edge, a right foot on great platform and a left foot on small jib. From there, make a big push with both legs to a left hand at the lip, hold the swing, reel in the feet, gain a right foot edge at the horizontal seam, release the tension by plumbing the left hand line and bring the right hand to a nothing hold by the left, reverse direction by gaining the right hand jug, place a left heel hook near the left hand, match on the jug, bring the heel along, flag the right foot, gain the right hand sidepull, edge with the right foot on the horizontal seam, square up, almost toe hook, slap into the left hand edge, toe with the right foot and bring the heel along to the jug, bump the right hand up to a good pinch edge on the feature, follow to a left hand edge at the lip with a decent thumb, move to right hand diagonal incut finger-lock, stand up to a good left hand past the lip, move the feet up, use a right hand sidepull saucer to bump to a good right hand bump, and mantel on top.
content.protection: Four pads worked well. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Make Believe.

content.description:
This problem is a phenomenal, perfect problem. The 2nd hold is a little suspect, but otherwise this thing is a GEM! Don't forget to bring your crimp strength with you.

As with all Unaweep lines, if you know of a first ascent or party, please let me know, and I will update the info.
content.location:
Start just to the right of

Lover's Quarrel

on a jug, and make 2 savage moves out the roof linking into the topout of

Lover's Quarrel

.
